metadata.title: Craft Labor and Mechanization in Nineteenth-Century American Canning

relevance.topic: Labor displacement due to technological change in the canning industry
relevance.relevance: The study examines the impact of mechanization on craft labor in the canning industry, highlighting how technological changes led to labor displacement and changes in labor dynamics.

design.sample_characteristics: Focus on the American canning industry post-Civil War, with emphasis on craft labor and mechanization.

dependent_variables.displaced: Craft workers were displaced due to mechanization.
dependent_variables.unemployment_or_underemployment: Craft workers faced wage cuts and reduced bargaining power.
dependent_variables.wage_changes: Wages for cappers and processors decreased significantly.

text_fragments: "The Boss-Capper helped hasten the day of his own exit through his overbearing thoughtlessness."
"Why Cap Longer by Old Methods when Cox's Capper Fills the Bill-It Saves Labor-It Saves Solder-It Never Tires-It Never Strikes."
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes how mechanization in the canning industry led to the displacement of craft labor, focusing on the introduction of deskilling machinery and its impact on labor dynamics.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Post-Civil War economic growth with increasing demand for canned goods.
historical_context.institutional_context: Craft workers had significant bargaining power, which was challenged by mechanization.

outcomes.main_findings: Mechanization in the canning industry led to the displacement of craft labor, reduced wages, and increased managerial control.
outcomes.conclusions: Technological changes in the canning industry reduced the power of craft labor and increased profitability through labor displacement and deskilling.
outcomes.long_term_impacts: The study suggests that mechanization contributed to the decline of craft unions and altered labor dynamics in the industry.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: The study relies on historical data and case studies, which may not capture all aspects of labor displacement.
quality_assessment.coherence: The study provides a coherent narrative of the impact of mechanization on labor dynamics in the canning industry.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: The study uses historical data and case studies to support its findings, but lacks quantitative measures of displacement.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is relevant to understanding the impact of technological change on labor displacement in historical contexts.
